senses.sense_definition: The defensive player in baseball positioned between second base and third base.

examples.text: The <w>shortstop</w> caught the ground ball and threw it to first base for the out.
He has been the team's starting <w>shortstop</w> for three consecutive seasons.

senses.sense_definition: A person who acts as a nimble defender or intermediary in a situation.

examples.text: I will act as <w>shortstop</w> during the negotiations to handle any sudden issues.
She served as a <w>shortstop</w> for the project, catching errors before they reached the client.

senses.sense_definition: A gambler who does not have enough money to continue playing.

examples.text: The <w>shortstops</w> were asked to leave the table because they could not cover their bets.
He was labeled a <w>shortstop</w> after running out of chips in the first hour.

senses.sense_definition: To play the position of shortstop in a baseball game.

examples.text: He <w>shortstopped</w> for the local team before going professional.
She has <w>shortstopped</w> effectively all season, making very few errors.

senses.sense_definition: To cause a process or action to stop prematurely or abruptly.

examples.text: The chemical reaction must be <w>shortstopped</w> to prevent the mixture from hardening too quickly.
They <w>shortstopped</w> the assault by cutting off the enemy's supply line.
